short_summary: Construction Services for Boiler & Make-up Air Unit Replacement at Indian Head Research Farm.
description: This bid solicitation seeks a contractor to replace the boiler and make-up air unit at the Crop Services building in the Indian Head Research Farm. The selected contractor will be responsible for the removal and replacement of the HVAC components, installation of associated ducting, piping, and electrical work, and provision of project documentation.
full_summary:
> # Boiler Make-up Air Unit Replacement, Indian Head Research Farm

> ## Tender Information

| Key Item | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Solicitation Number | 01R11-25-001 |
| Tender Closing Date | April 26, 2024, 1:00 p.m. CDT |
| Procurement Method | Competitive Open Bidding |
| Contracting Entity | Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada |

> ## Project Description

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) invites interested parties to participate in the procurement process for the Boiler and Make-up Air Unit Replacement project at the Indian Head Research Farm. The project involves the replacement of various HVAC components, including two indirect-fired make-up air units, a heating boiler, and a gas-fired water heater in Building #21 of the Indian Head Research Farm. The successful candidate will be responsible for the installation of all associated ducting, piping, and electrical work as outlined in the project documents, as well as air balancing of the building systems and provision of project documentation.

> ## Evaluation Process

This is a two-phase selection process. The first phase requires bidders to submit a bid package containing qualifications and experience, followed by an evaluation of the Phase One bids to determine the competitive standing of bidders. Qualified bidders will then be invited to submit a Phase Two bid, which will cover pricing.

> ## Submission Guidelines

Bid submission must be in PDF format and emailed to aafc.wscprocurement-csoapprovisionnement.aac@agr.gc.ca, with a clear subject line identifying the Phase One bid submission, including the solicitation number. The Phase One Submission Form and any required associated documents must be in PDF format, and include the following information:

* Solicitation number
* Bidder name and contact information
* Bidder return address
* Phase One solicitation closing date and time

> ## Important Notes

* Bidder is responsible for ensuring timely and correct delivery of the electronic bid.
* Canada is not responsible for any failure attributable to email transmission or receipt of the bid.
* The maximum email message size, including all file attachments, must not exceed 5MB.
* Zip, exe, mp3 files and links to Bid Documents will not be accepted.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.ate of Contract: Not Specified
* End Date of Contract: Not Specified
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
